wikipedia_page.main: William Mitchell Penman (12 May 1917 – 3 October 1943) was a Scottish international rugby union player who was killed in World War II when he, serving as a captain of a Lancaster bomber, was shot down over Kassel.He was capped once for Scotland in 1939. He also played for the Royal Air Force Rugby Union.

response: William Penman is the name of:
*William Penman (rugby union) (1917–1943), Scottish rugby union player
